creator: olivier.lecorne@ca-dialog.fr
text:
We use a RollingFileAppender and set it up to write in a file which is on a 
disk accessible by the LAN (e.g. L:\logs\logfile.txt).
When a network error occurs, the file is no more reacheable and the 
OnlyOnceErrorHandler logs the first error; then, the appender loses all the 
next logs.
If the network error is corrected and the file is now reacheable, the appender 
still loses the logs. It seems that it does not check again if the file is 
reacheable so if the file is not reacheable once, the appender is KO "for ever".

This is more an evolution than a real bug but, please, let me know if Log4j is 
planning to solve this case.

I'm trying to develop a solution...

creator: yoavs@computer.org
text:
Then use a different error handler than the OnceOnlyErrorHandler ;)  And in 
that error handler, define a backup appender which writes to a local file.

For more advice on this and other scenarios, please use the log4j-user mailing 
list.  Bugzilla is not a good discussion forum.
